definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to reflect (light)/to shine/to project (an image onto a screen etc)

sentences.english: One of his masterpieces, Princess Mononoke, has had a great influence since its public release.
sentences.chinese: 是其重要作品之一，公映後產生很大的影響。

sentences.english: There’s one out now about a talking horse.
sentences.chinese: 現在有一部關於一匹會說話的馬的電影在公映。

sentences.english: It's taken the top box office place since opening to the public just a few days.
sentences.chinese: 公映幾天以來，它一直佔據着票房榜榜首的位置。

sentences.english: The labeled doors are still visible in the released version of Empire.
sentences.chinese: 在《帝國反擊戰》的公映版中仍能看見有標籤的門。

sentences.english: Boyle's latest hit "Slumdog Millionaire, " which took eight awards in this year's Academy Award Ceremony, will be shown across the Chinese mainland beginning Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 《貧民窟的百萬富翁》將於26日在內地公映。

definition: to premiere (a movie or TV show)/premiere (of a movie)/first-run (movie)/to greet (the eye) before anything else (e.g. when entering a room)
theater chain (abbr. for 電影院線|电影院线)
to act the leading role (in a movie or a play)/to star/lead actor
